title: Perplexity 검색, 소스 1
content:
Here are some of the latest developments and advanced technologies in artificial intelligence:

## Generative AI

Generative AI has made significant strides recently, moving beyond just chatbots:

- OpenAI's GPT-4 model can process text, audio, images and videos, expanding its multimodal capabilities[1][2].
- There's a trend toward building software applications on top of large language models rather than deploying standalone chatbots[3].
- Text-to-video models like OpenAI's Sora and voice generation tools like ElevenLabs are pushing the boundaries of AI-generated content[3].

## AI Agents

Agentic AI models capable of more autonomous action are an emerging frontier:

- Tools like Salesforce's Agentforce can autonomously handle tasks like scheduling and data analysis for business users[3].
- AI agents can adapt to new information in real-time and make independent decisions, unlike simple automation[3].
- However, this autonomy also raises new ethical concerns about potential mistakes or unintended consequences[3].

## Multimodal AI

AI systems that can process multiple types of data are becoming more prevalent:

- Models like Google's Gemini can handle text, audio, images and video simultaneously[1].
- This allows for more sophisticated reasoning and outputs across various data types[1].
- Multimodal AI is expected to enable new applications in fields like healthcare, education and content creation[1].

## AI in Robotics

Robotics is another area where AI is making significant advances:

- Foundation models for robotics could potentially be even more transformative than generative AI[3].
- At UC San Diego, researchers are developing AI-powered surgical robots that can recognize blood, control hemorrhaging, and autonomously perform certain procedures[4].

## Specialized AI Applications

AI is being applied in increasingly specialized and impactful ways:

- Social robots to assist people with cognitive impairments[4]
- AI-powered mobile platforms for managing chronic health conditions[4]
- Self-driving vehicles for delivery and micro-transit on campuses[4]

As AI technologies continue to evolve rapidly, we're likely to see even more innovative applications and capabilities emerge in the near future.
